context: The Finnish word 'pyörä' means bike or bicycle in English. It refers to a two-wheeled vehicle that is propelled by pedaling. The word is neutral and can be used for any type of bicycle - mountain bikes, road bikes, children's bikes, etc. In Finnish grammar, it follows standard noun declension patterns with different cases like pyörä (nominative), pyörän (genitive), pyörällä (adessive), etc.
